libupkeeper/upkeeper/upk_protocol.h

00001 #ifndef _UPK_PROTOCOL_H
00002 #define _UPK_PROTOCOL_H

00023 #include "upk_error.h"
00024 #include "upk_types.h"
00025 
00026 /* ********************************************************************************************************************
00027    enums must preserve order. To add support for a new protocol version, create a new vN interface, add whatever
00028    additional fields necessary to a vN_protocol_structs.h and append the macro in the appropriate location here.  and
00029    add the version specific items to the switch in upk_protocol.c. Note that the underlying protocol does _not_ need to
00030    maintain anything as a subset; just the wrapper function must support old and new styles.  this allows for controlled 
00031    deprecation, while still providing protocol and API compatibility.
00032    ******************************************************************************************************************* */
00033 
00034 #define UPK_MAX_PACKET_SIZE 65536                          
00035 #define UPK_PACKET_HEADER_LEN 16
00036 #define UPK_PACKET_FOOTER_LEN 4
00037 
00038 #define UPK_MIN_SUPPORTED_PROTO 0
00039 #define UPK_MAX_SUPPORTED_PROTO 0
00040 
00041 #define UPK_DATA __upk_data
00042 #define UPK_DATA_PTR __upk_data_ptr
00043 #define UPK_DATA_LEN __upk_data_len
00044 #define UPK_BUF __upk_buf
00045 #define UPK_BUF_PTR __upk_buf_ptr
00046 #define UPK_UINT8_BUFFER __upk_uint8_buf
00047 #define UPK_UINT16_BUFFER __upk_uint16_buf
00048 #define UPK_UINT32_BUFFER __upk_uint32_buf
00049 #define UPK_STRING_LENGTH __upk_string_len
00050 
00051 /* XXX you will want to redefine these depending on the type of data you're dealing with */
00052 #define UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER_TYPEDEF upk_pkttype_t
00053 #define UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER pkttype
00054 
00055 #define UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE(TYPE) \
00056     TYPE * UPK_DATA = NULL; \
00057     unsigned char * UPK_BUF_PTR = UPK_BUF; \
00058     uint32_t UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = 0; \
00059     uint16_t UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = 0; \
00060     uint8_t UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = 0; \
00061     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = UPK_UINT32_BUFFER + 0; \
00062     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = UPK_UINT16_BUFFER + 0; \
00063     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = UPK_UINT8_BUFFER + 0
00064 
00065 
00066 #define UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB) MEMB ## _len
00067 
00068 #define UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE_MSG(TYPE) \
00069     UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE(TYPE); \
00070     UPK_DATA = calloc(1,sizeof(*UPK_DATA)); \
00071     UPK_FETCH_ENUM(UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER_TYPEDEF, UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER)
00072 
00073 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00074     memcpy(&UPK_UINT32_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)); \
00075     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) ntohl( UPK_UINT32_BUFFER ); \
00076     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)
00077 
00078 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT32(MEMB) \
00079     UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(uint32_t, MEMB)
00080 
00081 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT16_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00082     memcpy(&UPK_UINT16_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)); \
00083     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) ntohs( UPK_UINT16_BUFFER ); \
00084     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)
00085 
00086 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT16(MEMB) \
00087     UPK_FETCH_UINT16_T(uint16_t, MEMB)
00088 
00089 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00090     memcpy(&UPK_UINT8_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)); \
00091     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) UPK_UINT8_BUFFER; \
00092     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)
00093 
00094 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT8(MEMB) \
00095     UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(uint8_t, MEMB)
00096 
00097 #define UPK_FETCH_BOOL(MEMB) \
00098     UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(bool, MEMB)
00099 
00100 #define UPK_FETCH_ENUM(TYPE,MEMB) \
00101     UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(TYPE, MEMB)
00102 
00103 #define UPK_FETCH_STRING(MEMB) \
00104     UPK_DATA->MEMB = calloc(1, UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB) + 1);  /* null terminate */ \
00105     memcpy(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB)); \
00106     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB)
00107 
00108 #define UPK_FETCH_DATA_TO_BUF(BUF, LEN) \
00109     BUF = calloc(1, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00110     memcpy(BUF, UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00111     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->LEN
00112 
00113 #define UPK_FETCH_DATA(MEMB) \
00114     UPK_FETCH_DATA_TO_BUF(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB))
00115 
00116 #define UPK_FETCH_ARRAY(MEMB, LEN) \
00117     memcpy(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_BUF_PTR, LEN); \
00118     UPK_BUF_PTR += LEN
00119 
00120 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE(TYPE) \
00121     TYPE * UPK_DATA = (TYPE *) UPK_DATA_PTR; \
00122     upk_pkt_buf_t * UPK_BUF = NULL; \
00123     upk_pkt_buf_t * UPK_BUF_PTR = NULL; \
00124     uint32_t UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = 0; \
00125     uint16_t UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = 0; \
00126     uint8_t UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = 0; \
00127     size_t UPK_STRING_LENGTH = 0; \
00128     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = UPK_UINT32_BUFFER + 0; \
00129     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = UPK_UINT16_BUFFER + 0; \
00130     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = UPK_UINT8_BUFFER + 0; \
00131     UPK_STRING_LENGTH = UPK_STRING_LENGTH + 0
00132 
00133 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_BUF(TYPE, LEN) \
00134     UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE(TYPE); \
00135     UPK_BUF = calloc(1, LEN); \
00136     UPK_BUF_PTR = UPK_BUF
00137 
00138 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_MSG(TYPE) \
00139     UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_BUF(TYPE, UPK_DATA_LEN); \
00140     UPK_PUT_ENUM(UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER)
00141 
00142 #define UPK_PUT_UINT32(MEMB) \
00143     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = htonl( (uint32_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB ); \
00144     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT32_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)); \
00145     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)
00146 
00147 #define UPK_PUT_UINT16(MEMB) \
00148     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = htons( (uint16_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB ); \
00149     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT16_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)); \
00150     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)
00151 
00152 #define UPK_PUT_UINT8(MEMB) \
00153     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = (uint8_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB; \
00154     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT8_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)); \
00155     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)
00156 
00157 #define UPK_PUT_BOOL(MEMB) \
00158     UPK_PUT_UINT8(MEMB)
00159 
00160 #define UPK_PUT_ENUM(MEMB) \
00161     UPK_PUT_UINT32(MEMB)
00162 
00163 #define UPK_PUT_STRING(MEMB) \
00164     UPK_STRING_LENGTH = strnlen(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MAX_STRING_LEN); \
00165     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->MEMB, strnlen(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_STRING_LENGTH)); \
00166     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_STRING_LENGTH
00167 
00168 #define UPK_PUT_DATA_FROM_BUF(BUF, LEN) \
00169     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, BUF, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00170     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->LEN
00171 
00172 #define UPK_PUT_DATA(MEMB) \
00173     UPK_PUT_DATA_FROM_BUF(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB))
00174 
00175 #define UPK_PUT_ARRAY(MEMB, LEN) \
00176     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->MEMB, LEN); \
00177     UPK_BUF_PTR += LEN
00178 
00179 #ifdef __NEVERDEFINED_NEED_FOR_AUTOSCAN_TO_SEE_FUNCS_USED_IN_ABOVE_MACROS
00180 static inline void
00181 __never_compiled(void)
00182 {
00183     void                   *foo, *bar;
00184     int32_t                 baz = 1;
00185 
00186     foo = calloc(1, sizeof(int32_t));
00187     bar = calloc(1, sizeof(int32_t));
00188     memcpy(foo, bar, sizeof(int32_t));
00189     baz = strnlen("foobar", 64);
00190     baz = htonl(baz);
00191     baz = ntohl(baz);
00192     baz = (int32_t) htons((int16_t) baz);
00193     baz = (int32_t) ntohs((int16_t) baz);
00194 }
00195 #endif

00263 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00264    |----|----|----|<payload ...>|----|
00265    ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00266 typedef struct {
00267     uint32_t                payload_len;                   /* not size_t, because this would force the arch of the
00268                                                               client to match the server; and even on localhost, that
00269                                                               cannot be guaranteed */
00270     uint32_t                version_id;
00271     uint32_t                seq_num;
00272     upk_pkttype_t           pkttype;                       /* will be forced into a uint32_t; even on 64bit */
00273     void                   *payload;
00274     uint32_t                crc32;
00275 } upk_packet_t;
00276 
00277 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00278    |----|----|<client_name ...>|
00279    ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00280 typedef struct {
00281     upk_msgtype_t           msgtype;

00283     uint32_t                max_supported_ver;
00284     uint32_t                client_name_len;
00285     char                   *client_name;
00286 } upk_req_preamble_t;
